Translation of 郭店楚簡-魯穆公問子思(en) into English.

p.seg: Duke Mu of Lu asked Zi Si:
“How (should one act) to be called a loyal minister?”
Zi Si answered:
“One who is always mentioning what his lord dislikes
deserves to be called a loyal minister”.
The Duke was not pleased,
bowed and had him withdraw.
Cheng Sunyi came for an audience,
and the Duke said:
“Just now I asked Zi Si about being a loyal minister,
and Zi Si said:
One who is always mentioning what his lord dislikes
‘deserves to be called a loyal minister.’
I was puzzled by that,
and have not yet got (understood) it.”
Cheng Sunyi said:
“Ah, such beautiful words!”
Now, people who have sacrificed their lives because of their lord,
in the past there have been some;
(but) people who could constantly mention what their lord dislikes,
there has not yet been anyone
Now, someone who sacrifices his life because of his [lord],
is someone who receives salary and rank.
But someone who constantly [mentions what one’s lord] dislikes,
is someone who [removes] (from himself) salary and rank,
and to remove salary and rank (from oneself) [because of] righteousness,
if not for Zi Si,
how would have I heard of it?”
